head.supplied: ¶ [With reference to quarters for Mr Ferguson Inspr of Forests] ¶ M'sletter was referred back tohimon22 August 1870 minuted: 'how many housesarein the Gardens?'.M returned the letter to the Chief Sec...

div.p: No. 9712, vol. 1870 V, VPRS 1168/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Letter not found; item is a register entry only,of a letterdated 18 August 1870. On 18 July 1870,William Ferguson wrote to McCulloch asking that quarters be provided for him in the Botanic Garden (No. 8872, vol. 1870 V, VPRS 1168/P, Public Record Office, Victoria).Although no covering letter has been found,Ferguson's letter would have been transmitted through M, as Ferguson had recently been reprimanded for making direct contact;see M to W, Odgers,1 June 1870, n.2.On 4 August, the register entry was annotated: 'Director to provide with quarters to which Mr F entitled'.
[With reference to quarters for Mr Ferguson Inspr of Forests]
M'sletter was referred back tohimon22 August 1870 minuted: 'how many housesarein the Gardens?'.M returned the letter to the Chief Secretary'sOfficeon30 August. See also M to J. McCulloch, 26 August 1870(in this edition as 70-08-26a).
